questions.stem: Consider the following statements: P : I have fever, Q : I will not take medicine, R : I will take rest. The statement "If I have fever, then I will take medicine and I will take rest" is equivalent to:
questions.explanation: $P \rightarrow(\sim Q \wedge R)$, $\sim P \vee(\sim Q \wedge R)$, $(\sim P \vee \sim Q) \wedge(\sim P \vee R)$
questions.tip_formula: Logical equivalence: $P \rightarrow Q \equiv \sim P \vee Q$
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let A be a point on the x-axis. Common tangents are drawn from A to the curves $x^{2}+y^{2}=8$ and $y^{2}=16x$. If one of these tangents touches the two curves at Q and R, then $(QR)^{2}$ is equal to
questions.explanation: $y=m x+\frac{4}{m}$, $\frac{\left|\frac{4}{m}\right|}{\sqrt{1+m^{2}}}=2 \sqrt{2} \therefore m= \pm 1$, $y= \pm x \pm 4$. Point of contact on parabola Let $m=1,\left(\frac{a}{m^{2}}, \frac{2 a}{m}\right)$, R $(4,8)$, Point of contact on circle Q ( $-2,2$ ), $\therefore(QR)^{2}=36+36=72$
questions.tip_formula: Common tangent to circle and parabola
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $q$ be the maximum integral value of $p$ in $[0,10]$ for which the roots of the equation $x^{2}-p x+\frac{5}{4} p=0$ are rational. Then the area of the region $\{(x, y): 0 \leq y \leq(x-q)^{2}, 0 \leq x \leq q\}$ is
questions.explanation: $x^{2}-px+\frac{5p}{4}=0$, $D=p^{2}-5p=p(p-5)$, $\therefore q=9$, $0 \leq y \leq(x-9)^{2}$, , Area $=\int_{0}^{9}(x-9)^{2} dx=243$
questions.tip_formula: Discriminant for rational roots and area under parabola
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If the functions $f(x)=\frac{x^{3}}{3}+2 b x+\frac{a x^{2}}{2}$ and $g(x)=\frac{x^{3}}{3}+a x+b x^{2}, a \neq 2 b$ have a common extreme point, then $a+2 b+7$ is equal to
questions.explanation: $f^{\prime}(x)=x^{2}+2 b+a x$, $g^{\prime}(x)=x^{2}+a+2 bx$, $(2 b-a)-x(2 b-a)=0$, $\therefore x=1$ is the common root, Put $x=1$ in $f^{\prime}(x)=0$ or $g^{\prime}(x)=0$, $1+2 b+a=0$, $7+2 b+a=6$
questions.tip_formula: Common extreme point implies common critical point
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The range of the function $f(x)=\sqrt{3-x}+\sqrt{2+x}$ is
questions.tip_formula: Range of sum of square root functions using domain analysis
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The solution of the differential equation $\frac{d y}{d x}=-\left(\frac{x^{2}+3 y^{2}}{3 x^{2}+y^{2}}\right), y(1)=0$ is
questions.explanation: Put y = vx, $v+x \frac{d v}{d x}=-\left(\frac{1+3 v^{2}}{3+v^{2}}\right)$, $x \frac{d v}{d x}=-\frac{(v+1)^{3}}{3+v^{2}}$, $\frac{\left(3+v^{2}\right) d v}{(v+1)^{3}}+\frac{d x}{x}=0$, $\int \frac{4 d v}{(v+1)^{3}}+\int \frac{d v}{v+1}-\int \frac{2 d v}{(v+1)^{2}}+\int \frac{d x}{x}=0$, $\frac{-2}{(v+1)^{2}}+\ln (v+1)+\frac{2}{v+1}+\ln x=c$, $\frac{-2 x^{2}}{(x+y)^{2}}+\ln \left(\frac{x+y}{x}\right)+\frac{2 x}{x+y}+\ln x=c$, $\frac{2 x y}{(x+y)^{2}}+\ln (x+y)=c$, $\therefore c=0$, as $x=1, y=0$, $\therefore \frac{2 x y}{(x+y)^{2}}+\ln (x+y)=0$
questions.tip_formula: Homogeneous differential equation solved by substitution y = vx
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $x=(8 \sqrt{3}+13)^{13}$ and $y=(7 \sqrt{2}+9)^{9}$. If [t] denotes the greatest integer $\leq t$, then
questions.tip_formula: Binomial expansion and conjugate pairs for integer properties
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: A vector $\vec{v}$ in the first octant is inclined to the x-axis at $60^{\circ}$, to the y-axis at $45^{\circ}$ and to the z-axis at an acute angle. If a plane passing through the points $(\sqrt{2},-1,1)$ and $(a, b, c)$, is normal to $\vec{v}$, then
questions.explanation: $\hat{v}=\cos 60^{\circ} \hat{i}+\cos 45^{\circ} \hat{j}+\cos \gamma \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow \frac{1}{4}+\frac{1}{2}+\cos ^{2} \gamma=1 \quad(\gamma \rightarrow$ Acute $)$, $\Rightarrow \cos \gamma=\frac{1}{2}$, $\Rightarrow \gamma=60^{\circ}$, Equation of plane is $\frac{1}{2}(x-\sqrt{2})+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(y+1)+\frac{1}{2}(z-1)=0$, $\Rightarrow x+\sqrt{2} y+z=1$, ( $a, b, c$ ) lies on it, $\Rightarrow a+\sqrt{2} b+c=1$
questions.tip_formula: Direction cosines and equation of plane with given normal
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $f, g$ and $h$ be the real valued functions defined on $\mathbb{R}$ as $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}\frac{x}{|x|}, & x \neq 0 \\ 1, & x=0\end{array}\right.$, $g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cl}\frac{\sin (x+1)}{(x+1)}, & x \neq -1 \\ 1, & x=-1\end{array}\right.$ and $h(x)=2[x]-f(x)$, where $[x]$ is the greatest integer $\leq x$. Then the value of $\lim _{x \rightarrow 1} g(h(x-1))$ is
questions.explanation: $\mathrm{LHL}=\lim _{k \rightarrow 0} g(h(-k)) \quad, k>0$, $=\lim _{k \rightarrow 0} g(-2+1) \quad \because f(x)=-1 \forall x<0$, $=g(-1)=1$, $\mathrm{RHL}=\lim _{k \rightarrow 0} g(h(k)) \quad, k>0$, $=\lim _{k \rightarrow 0} g(-1) \quad, \because f(x)=1, \forall x>0$, $=1$
questions.tip_formula: Piecewise functions and limit evaluation
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of ways of selecting two numbers $a$ and $b$, $a \in\{2,4,6, \ldots ., 100\}$ and $b \in\{1,3,5, \ldots ., 99\}$ such that 2 is the remainder when $a+b$ is divided by 23 is
questions.explanation: $a \in\{2,4,6,8,10, \ldots ., 100\}$, $b \in\{1,3,5,7,9, \ldots ., 99\}$, Now, $a+b \in\{25,71,117,163\}$, (i) $a+b=25$, no. of ordered pairs (a, b) is 12, (ii) $a+b=71$, no. of ordered pairs ( $a, b$ ) is 35, (iii) $a+b=117$, no. of ordered pairs ( $a, b$ ) is 42, (iv) $a+b=163$, no. of ordered pairs ( $a, b$ ) is 19, $\therefore$ total $=108$ pairs
questions.tip_formula: Modular arithmetic and counting ordered pairs
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If P is a $3 \times 3$ real matrix such that $P^{T}=aP+(a-1) I$, where $a>1$, then
questions.explanation: $P^{T}=aP+(a-1) I$, $\Rightarrow P=aP^{T}+(a-1) I$, $\Rightarrow P^{T}-P=a\left(P-P^{T}\right)$, $\Rightarrow P=P^{T}$, as $a \neq -1$, Now, $P=aP+(a-1) I$, $\Rightarrow P=-I \Rightarrow|P|=1$, $\Rightarrow|\operatorname{Adj} P|=1$
questions.tip_formula: Matrix transpose properties and determinant of adjoint
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $\lambda \in \mathbb{R}, \vec{a}=\lambda \hat{i}+2 \hat{j}-3 \hat{k}, \vec{b}=\hat{i}-\lambda \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$. If $((\vec{a}+\vec{b}) \times(\vec{a} \times \vec{b})) \times(\vec{a}-\vec{b})=8 \hat{i}-40 \hat{j}-24 \hat{k}$, then $|\lambda(\vec{a}+\vec{b}) \times(\vec{a}-\vec{b})|^{2}$ is equal to
questions.explanation: $\vec{a}=\lambda \hat{i}+2 \hat{j}-3 \hat{k}$, $\vec{b}=\hat{i}-\lambda \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow(\vec{b}-\vec{a}) \times((\vec{a}+\vec{b}) \times(\vec{a} \times \vec{b}))=8 \hat{i}-40 \hat{j}-24 \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow((\vec{a}-\vec{b}) \cdot(\vec{a}+\vec{b}))(\vec{a} \times \vec{b})=8 \hat{i}-40 j-24 \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow 8(\vec{a} \times \vec{b})=8 \hat{i}-40 \hat{j}-24 \hat{k}$, Now, $\vec{a} \times \vec{b}=\left|\begin{array}{ccc}\hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \\ \lambda & 2 & -3 \\ 1 & -\lambda & 2\end{array}\right|$, $=(4-3 \lambda) \hat{i}-(2 \lambda+3) \hat{j}+\left(-\lambda^{2}-2\right) \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow \lambda=1$, $\therefore \vec{a}=\hat{i}+2 \hat{j}-3 \hat{k}$, $\vec{b}=\hat{i}-\hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow \vec{a}+\vec{b}=2 \hat{i}+\hat{j}-\hat{k}, \vec{a}-\vec{b}=3 \hat{j}-5 \hat{k}$, $\Rightarrow(\vec{a}+\vec{b}) \times(\vec{a}-\vec{b})=\left|\begin{array}{ccc}\hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \\ 2 & 1 & -1 \\ 0 & 3 & -5\end{array}\right|=2 \hat{i}+10 \hat{j}+6 \hat{k}$, $\therefore$ required answer $=4+100+36=140$
questions.tip_formula: Vector triple product identities and cross product calculation
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{b}$ be two vectors. Let $|\vec{a}|=1,|\vec{b}|=4$ and $\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}=2$. If $\vec{c}=(2 \vec{a} \times \vec{b})-3 \vec{b}$, then the value of $\vec{b} \cdot \vec{c}$ is
questions.explanation: $\vec{c}=(2 \vec{a} \times \vec{b})-3 \vec{b}$, $\vec{b} \cdot \vec{c}=\vec{b} \cdot(2 \vec{a} \times \vec{b})-3 \vec{b} \cdot \vec{b}$, $=-3|b|^{2}$, $=-48$
questions.tip_formula: Dot product with cross product is zero: $\vec{b} \cdot (\vec{a} \times \vec{b}) = 0$
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $a_{1}=1, a_{2}, a_{3}, a_{4}, \ldots$ be consecutive natural numbers. Then $\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{1+a_{1} a_{2}}\right)+\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{1+a_{2} a_{3}}\right) +\ldots +\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{1+a_{2021} a_{2022}}\right)$ is equal to
questions.tip_formula: Telescoping series using $\tan^{-1} x - \tan^{-1} y = \tan^{-1}\left(\frac{x-y}{1+xy}\right)$
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The parabolas : $a x^{2}+2 b x+c y=0$ and $d x^{2}+2 e x+f y=0$ intersect on the line $y=1$. If $a, b, c, d, e, f$ are positive real numbers and $a, b, c$ are in G.P., then

options.text: d, e, f are in A.P.
d, e, f are in G.P.

questions.explanation: $a x^{2}+2 b x+c=0$, $\Rightarrow a x^{2}+2 \sqrt{a c} x+c=0\left(\because b^{2}=a c\right)$, $\Rightarrow(x \sqrt{a}+\sqrt{c})^{2}=0$, $x^{2}-\frac{\sqrt{c}}{\sqrt{a}}$, Now, $dx^{2}+2 ex+f=0$, $\Rightarrow d\left(\frac{c}{a}\right)+2 e\left[-\frac{\sqrt{c}}{\sqrt{a}}\right]+f=0$, $\Rightarrow \frac{dc}{a}+f=2 e \sqrt{\frac{c}{a}}$, $\Rightarrow \frac{d}{a}+\frac{f}{c}=2 e \sqrt{\frac{1}{ac}}$, $\Rightarrow \frac{d}{a}+\frac{f}{c}=\frac{2 e}{b}[$ as $b=\sqrt{ae}]$, $\therefore \frac{d}{a}, \frac{e}{b}, \frac{f}{c}$ are in A.P.
questions.tip_formula: Geometric progression and intersection of parabolas
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If a plane passes through the points $(-1, k, 0),(2, k,-1),(1,1,2)$ and is parallel to the line $\frac{x-1}{1}=\frac{2 y+1}{2} =\frac{z+1}{-1}$, then the value of $\frac{k^{2}+1}{(k-1)(k-2)}$ is
questions.explanation: $\frac{x-1}{1}=\frac{2 y+1}{2}=\frac{z+1}{-1}$, $\frac{x-1}{1}=\frac{y+\frac{1}{2}}{1}=\frac{z+1}{-1}$, Points : $A(-1, k, 0), B(2, k,-1), C(1,1,2)$, $\vec{CA}=-2 \hat{i}+(k-1) \hat{j}-2 \hat{k}$, $\vec{CB}=\hat{i}+(k-1) \hat{j}-3 \hat{k}$, $\vec{CA} \times \vec{CB}=\left|\begin{array}{ccc}\hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \\ -2 & k-1 & -2 \\ 1 & k-1 & -3\end{array}\right|$, $=\hat{i}(-3 k+3+2 k-2)-\hat{j}(6+2)+\hat{k}(-2 k+2-k+1)$, $=(1-k) \hat{i}-8 \hat{j}+(3-3 k) \hat{k}$, The line $\frac{x-1}{1}=\frac{y+\frac{1}{2}}{1}=\frac{z+1}{-1}$ is perpendicular to normal vector, $\therefore 1 \cdot(1-k)+1(-8)+(-1)(3-3 k)=0$, $\Rightarrow 1-k-8-3+3 k=0$, $\Rightarrow 2 k=10 \Rightarrow k=5$, $\therefore \frac{k^{2}+1}{(k-1)(k-2)}=\frac{26}{4 \cdot 3}=\frac{13}{6}$
questions.tip_formula: Plane through three points and parallel to line condition
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.subtopic: Plane through points and parallel to line

questions.stem: Let $a, b, c>1, a^{3}, b^{3}$ and $c^{3}$ be in A.P., and $\log_{a} b$, $\log_{c} a$ and $\log_{b} c$ be in G.P. If the sum of first 20 terms of an A.P., whose first term is $\frac{a+4 b+c}{3}$ and the common difference is $\frac{a-8 b+c}{10}$ is -444 , then abc is equal to
questions.explanation: As $a^{3}, b^{3}, c^{3}$ be in A.P. $\rightarrow a^{3}+c^{3}=2 b^{3}$, $\log_{a}^{b}, \log_{c}^{a}, \log_{b}^{c}$ are in G.P., $\therefore \frac{\log b}{\log a} \cdot \frac{\log c}{\log b}=\left(\frac{\log a}{\log c}\right)^{2}$, $\therefore(\log a)^{3}=(\log c)^{3} \Rightarrow a=c$, From (1) and (2) $a=b=c$, $T_{1}=\frac{a+4 b+c}{3}=2 a ; d=\frac{a-8 b+c}{10}=\frac{-6 a}{10}=\frac{-3}{5} a$, $\therefore S_{20}=\frac{20}{2}\left[4 a+19\left(-\frac{3}{5} a\right)\right]$, $=10\left[\frac{20 a-57 a}{5}\right]$, $=-74 a$, $\therefore-74 a=-444 \Rightarrow a=6$, $\therefore abc=6^{3}=216$
questions.tip_formula: Arithmetic progression, geometric progression, and logarithmic properties
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let S be the set of all values of $a_{1}$ for which the mean deviation about the mean of 100 consecutive positive integers $a_{1}, a_{2}, a_{3}, \ldots, a_{100}$ is 25 . Then $S$ is
questions.explanation: let $a_{1}$ be any natural number, $a_{1}, a_{1}+1, a_{1}+2, \ldots ., a_{1}+99$ are values of $a_{i}$ ' S, $\bar{x}=\frac{a_{1}+(a_{1}+1)+(a_{1}+2)+\ldots . .+a_{1}+99}{100}$, $=\frac{100 a_{1}+(1+2+\ldots . .+99)}{100}=a_{1}+\frac{99 \times 100}{2 \times 100}$, $=a_{1}+\frac{99}{2}$, Mean deviation about mean $=\frac{\sum_{1=1}^{100}\left|x_{i}-\bar{x}\right|}{100}$, $=\frac{2\left(\frac{99}{2}+\frac{97}{2}+\frac{95}{2}+\ldots .+\frac{1}{2}\right)}{100}$, $=\frac{1+3+\ldots \ldots+99}{100}$, $=\frac{\frac{50}{2}[1+99]}{100}$, $=25$, So, it is true for every natural no. ' $a_{1}{ }^{\prime}$
questions.tip_formula: Mean deviation of consecutive integers is independent of starting value
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{3}{n}\left\{4+\left(2+\frac{1}{n}\right)^{2}+\left(2+\frac{2}{n}\right)^{2}+\ldots+\left(3-\frac{1}{n}\right)^{2}\right\}$ is equal to
questions.explanation: $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{3}{n} \sum_{r=0}^{n-1}\left(2+\frac{r}{n}\right)^{2}$, $=3 \int_{0}^{1}(2+x)^{2} dx=27-8=19$
questions.tip_formula: Limit of sum as definite integral
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.subtopic: Limit of sum as definite integral

questions.stem: For $\alpha, \beta \in \mathbb{R}$, suppose the system of linear equations $x-y+z=5$, $2 x+2 y+\alpha z=8$, $3 x-y+4 z=\beta$ has infinitely many solutions. Then $\alpha$ and $\beta$ are the roots of
questions.explanation: $\left|\begin{array}{ccc}1 & -1 & 1 \\ 2 & 2 & \alpha \\ 3 & -1 & 4\end{array}\right|=0 ; 8+\alpha-2(-4+1)+3(-\alpha-2)=0$, $8+\alpha+6-3 \alpha-6=0$, $\alpha=4$
questions.tip_formula: System of equations with infinite solutions: determinant = 0
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: $50^{\text{th}}$ root of a number x is 12 and $50^{\text{th}}$ root of another number $y$ is 18 . Then the remainder obtained on dividing $(x+y)$ by 25 is _______.
questions.tip_formula: Binomial expansion modulo 25
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $A=\{1,2,3,5,8,9\}$. Then the number of possible functions $f: A \rightarrow A$ such that $f(m \cdot n)=f(m) \cdot f(n)$ for every $m, n \in A$ with $m \cdot n \in A$ is equal to _______.
questions.explanation: $f(1)=1 ; f(9)=f(3) \times f(3)$, i.e., $f(3)=1$ or 3, Total function $=1 \times 6 \times 2 \times 6 \times 6 \times 1=432$
questions.tip_formula: Multiplicative functions on finite sets
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let $P(a_{1}, b_{1})$ and $Q(a_{2}, b_{2})$ be two distinct points on a circle with center $C(\sqrt{2}, \sqrt{3})$. Let O be the origin and OC be perpendicular to both CP and CQ . If the area of the triangle OCP is $\frac{\sqrt{35}}{2}$, then $a_{1}^{2}+a_{2}^{2}+b_{1}^{2}+b_{2}^{2}$ is equal to _______.
questions.explanation: $\frac{1}{2} \times PC \times \sqrt{5}=\frac{\sqrt{35}}{2} ; PC=\sqrt{7}$, , $a_{1}^{2}+b_{1}^{2}+a_{2}^{2}+b_{2}^{2}=OP^{2}+OQ^{2}$, $=2(5+7)=24$
questions.tip_formula: Circle geometry and distance formula
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The $8^{\text{th}}$ common term of the series $S_{1}=3+7+11+15+19+\ldots$, $S_{2}=1+6+11+16+21+\ldots$ is _______.
questions.tip_formula: Common terms of arithmetic progressions
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let a line $L$ pass through the point $P(2,3,1)$ and be parallel to the line $x+3 y-2 z-2=0=x-y+2 z$. If the distance of L from the point $(5,3,8)$ is $\alpha$, then $3 \alpha^{2}$ is equal to _______.
questions.explanation: $\left|\begin{array}{ccc}\hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \\ 1 & 3 & -2 \\ 1 & -1 & 2\end{array}\right|=4 \hat{i}-4 \hat{j}-4 \hat{k}$, $\therefore$ Equation of line is $\frac{x-2}{1}=\frac{y-3}{-1}=\frac{z-1}{-1}$, Let Q be $(5,3,8)$ and foot of $\perp$ from Q on this line be R, Now, $R \equiv(k+2,-k+3,-k+1)$, DR of QR are ( $k-3,-k,-k-7$ ), $\therefore(1)(k-3)+(-1)(-k)+(-1)(-k-7)=0$, $\Rightarrow k=-\frac{4}{3}$, $\therefore \alpha^{2}=\left(\frac{13}{3}\right)^{2}+\left(\frac{4}{3}\right)^{2}+\left(\frac{17}{3}\right)^{2}=\frac{474}{9}$, $\therefore 3 \alpha^{2}=158$
questions.tip_formula: Distance from point to line in 3D space
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If $\int \sqrt{\sec 2 x-1} dx=\alpha \log_{e}\left|\cos 2 x+\beta+\sqrt{\cos 2 x\left(1+\cos \frac{1}{\beta} x\right)}\right|$ + constant, then $\beta-\alpha$ is equal to _______.
questions.explanation: $\int \sqrt{\sec 2 x-1} dx=\int \sqrt{\frac{1-\cos 2 x}{\cos 2 x}} dx$, $=\sqrt{2} \int \frac{\sin x}{\sqrt{2 \cos ^{2} x-1}} dx$, put $\cos x=t \quad \Rightarrow-\sin xdx=dt$, $=-\sqrt{2} \int \frac{dt}{\sqrt{2 t^{2}-1}}$, $=-\ln |\sqrt{2} \cos x+\sqrt{\cos 2 x}|+c$, $=-\frac{1}{2} \ln \left|2 \cos ^{2} x+\cos 2 x+2 \sqrt{\cos 2 x} \cdot \sqrt{2} \cos x\right|+c$, $=-\frac{1}{2} \ln \left|\cos 2 x+\frac{1}{2}+\sqrt{\cos 2 x} \cdot \sqrt{1+\cos 2 x}\right|+c$, $\because \beta=\frac{1}{2}, \alpha=-\frac{1}{2} \Rightarrow \beta-\alpha=1$
questions.tip_formula: Integration of trigonometric expressions using substitution
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: If the value of real number $a>0$ for which $x^{2}-5 a x +1=0$ and $x^{2}-a x-5=0$ have a common real roots is $\frac{3}{\sqrt{2 \beta}}$ then $\beta$ is equal to _______.
questions.explanation: Two equations have common root, $\therefore(4 a)(26 a)=(-6)^{2}=36$, $\Rightarrow a^{2}=\frac{9}{26} \quad \therefore a=\frac{3}{\sqrt{26}} \Rightarrow \beta=13$
questions.tip_formula: Common roots of quadratic equations
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: The number of seven digits odd numbers, that can be formed using all the seven digits $1,2,2,2,3,3,5$ is _______.
questions.explanation: Digits are $1,2,2,2,3,3,5$, If unit digit 5 , then total numbers $=\frac{6!}{3!2!}$, If unit digit 3 , then total numbers $=\frac{6!}{3!}$, If unit digit 1 , then total numbers $=\frac{6!}{3!2!}$, $\therefore$ total numbers $=60+60+120=240$
questions.tip_formula: Permutations with repeated digits and odd number condition
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: A bag contains six balls of different colours. Two balls are drawn in succession with replacement. The probability that both the balls are of the same colour is p. Next four balls are drawn in succession with replacement and the probability that exactly three balls are of the same colours is $q$. If $p: q=m : n$, where $m$ and $n$ are coprime, then $m+n$ is equal to _______.
questions.explanation: $p=\frac{{ }^{6} C_{1}}{6 \times 6}=\frac{1}{6}$, $q=\frac{{ }^{6} C_{1} \times{ }^{5} C_{1} \times 4}{6 \times 6 \times 6 \times 6}=\frac{5}{54}$, $\therefore p: q=9: 5 \Rightarrow m+n=14$
questions.tip_formula: Probability with replacement and combinations
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.stem: Let A be the area of the region $\left\{(x, y): y \geq x^{2}, y \geq(1-x)^{2}, y \leq 2 x(1-x)\right\}$. Then 540 A is equal to
questions.explanation: , $A=2 \int_{\frac{1}{3}}^{\frac{1}{2}}\left(2 x-2 x^{2}-(1-x)^{2}\right) d x$, $=2\left[2 x^{2}-x^{3}-x\right]_{1 / 3}^{1 / 2}$, $\therefore A=\frac{5}{108} \Rightarrow 540 A=\frac{5}{108} \times 540=25$
questions.tip_formula: Area between curves using integration
questions.subject: Mathematics
